author: irreducible.eth
content: if the block proposers are selected  deterministically (pseudo-randomly), is it a risk that arb bot or nft mint bot can DDoS the block proposer at each slot? Solana was down a few times because of this. Is this a concern for the merge?

author: treyzania
content: kinda yeah that is a risk but solana has other issues (not having a functional fee market) that made that problem worse

author: irreducible.eth
content: the ddos bot's strategy was to spam the block proposer so that the proposer won't be able to include competitor's tx. This could still be a risk even with a fee market

author: 3xmd1559sporebraytondingo
content: this is certainly a risk, however SSLE (Single Secret Leader Election) is on the roadmap!

author: 3xmd1559sporebraytondingo
content: https://ethresear.ch/search?q=SSLE

author: yokem55
content: It would be difficult to pull off. Validators are only selected for proposals 1 epoch before... and the attacker would have had to done a lot of sniffing of the p2p network to figure out which validators were hosted  by which beacon nodes.

author: 3xmd1559sporebraytondingo
content: To the best of my knowledge this is the only discussion on MSLE; it's been discounted since it leads to a time buying attack: https://ethresear.ch/t/secret-non-single-leader-election/11789

author: 3xmd1559sporebraytondingo
content: Polkadot seems to support multiple 'simultaneous' (non-secret) block proposals, though it seems to me that priority is given to the first proposed block to be received. This would give an advantage to geographic centralisation, which inherently gives advantage to groups that can coordinate the location of their stake.

author: 3xmd1559sporebraytondingo
content: I don't know if Algorand has implemented SSLE though it seems to be on their roadmap too.

author: 3xmd1559sporebraytondingo
content: Cardano explicitly recommends consensus nodes to run their own relay nodes: https://docs.cardano.org/development-guidelines/guidelines-for-large-spos

author: 3xmd1559sporebraytondingo
content: So it would be possible in the long term to have game-theoretically trust-minimised relay networks "shielding" the validator networks from direct exposure to malicious tx propagators.

author: irreducible.eth
content: thanks a lot for the pointers! Looks like a solvable problem in the long term. In the short term, the attack surface is still worrisome, especially if such ddos-style spamming strategy can be profitable. Good to know that SSLE is on the roadmap!
